boardgame.name: Cube World Atlas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A visual guide to the world containing Vornheim, the Red & Pleasant Land, the Devoured Land from Frostbitten & Mutilated, the Maze of the Blue Medusa and every other thing I made up for my campaign.

15 maps, 14 continents, with overviews of what goes on in each one, including major cities and landmarks, notes on encounters, and a few options for sandbox campaigns that can take your players all over the Cube.

boardgame.name: I Am The Weapon Playtest Draft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Someone once commissioned me to write a superhero game with rules based on Demon City. It turned out great! My favorite character generation system, every power in the world, other dimensions, super comic-booky combat. Except: I never got to finish it.

It's now a very long text document with minimal formatting and lots of typos.

boardgame.name: Cube World Sandbox Kit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I have a bunch of tables and tools I use regularly at the table outside the ones already published in, like Vornheim and similar books. They go into the Cube World Sandbox Kit, 24 pages, with pictures (plus the most updated versions of the bestiary and treasure tables, of course).

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Imperial Lands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the East, a great Emperor holds sway. His vast and elegant empire is home to The Assassin's Opera, the Gongs of Inversion, the Lair of the Malachite Beast, and much more.

boardgame.name: Three at Sea
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three adventures at sea--turtle island, mantamen, derelict ships, werewolf pirates. You know--like in the ocean.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Spider God and The Idiot Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two complete dungeons, one suitable for low-level parties, one suitable for clever ones.

boardgame.name: In The Rolling Green
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Witch, changeling, banshee - three flexible scenarios featuring mystery, investigation, death and maybe romance depending how your players do it.

boardgame.name: In The Lands of the Southern Daimyos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The original Violence in the Nympharium had five or six adventures set in 17th century Japan. These versions are set in Cube World, along with a map of the area.

boardgame.name: The Cat, The Sphinx, and the Spinneskelle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Spinneskelle is a weird automaton that can fit into pretty much any adventure, the Black Sphinx is the answer to the riddle of why an obsessed scholar won't leave his library, and the demon cat of St Ylvyst's Hospital for Imbeciles and the Mad is just a jerk.

Three short adventures.

boardgame.name: The Stair and The Vizier's Secret
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A pair of small dungeons with unusual set-ups--one can go anywhere, another takes place on the outskirts of the wondrous city known as Abuzin Zeer, in the Scorpion Lands.

boardgame.name: Traps traps traps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The next installment of Cube World contains two dungeon adventures full of traps: Abelard Goatslayer and the Temple of Angra Mainyu.

boardgame.name: Warmutants of the Cube
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A generator for every kind of dangerous mutant animal along with adventures to put them in.

boardgame.name: Goblins and Murder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Masked goblins of the ports, the Goblin Market, and a murder mystery!

boardgame.name: The Pentamorph and More
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two adventures for players who can plan their schemes carefully. Five Powers of the Pentamorph--which takes in the city of Eelport in the chivalrous land of Broceliande--features a foe that has different abilities depending on how the party decides to approach it, One Last Score--which takes place in Tellach Avail, a beautiful city set hidden in the immense desert wastes of the Scorpion Lands--is a heist with a time limit.

boardgame.name: Two Cults
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two adventure set-ups featuring cults. Artistic Differences--which takes in the city of Port Gobelins in the chivalrous land of Broceliande--features three real historical people and the (probably) made-up octopus with which they are involved, The Cult of the Droll God--whose headquarters can be anywhere--is a conspiracy of jesters.

boardgame.name: Two Gimmicky Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two dungeons:

The Cartographer--a simple mapping challenge for players just learning to use their heads (which can take place anywhere. If the players figure out the gimmick, they’ll breeze through it, so it’s the kind of thing you might want to use as part of a larger adventure. If they don’t figure it out right away, it’ll be pretty funny when, after hours of fighting supernatural abominations, you tell them what they missed.

The Genizah is an adventure where players are probably going to want to learn to use stealth to avoid trouble. At heart it’s a simple a dungeon made to showcase a gauntlet of unusual enemies--so feel free to play up the atmosphere. It has golems and rabbis and cobras.

boardgame.name: Hell On Earth (and in Hell)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two adventures here: one unleashes The Four Beasts on a small and wartorn sandbox, and another takes players to A Small Hell where the party will have to climb over thousands of damned souls and dodge all manner of demons to get to the end.

boardgame.name: Four Elementals and a Giant's Gut
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two scenarios:
In You Can’t Say You Weren’t Warned the party is told exactly where to find their way to the heart of a complex full of terrifying creatures. Now the only problem is the terrifying creatures.

In The Vast Gut of Kvertelak the party is again told exactly where their goal is: in the stomach of 240’ frost giant. Piece of cake.

boardgame.name: The Fox Witch and the Freckled Hog
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Fox Witch, Eng-Ti is wild beyond imagining, and her hovel houses wonders, yet it is a place of woe.

The Freckled Hog is a tavern--and a good place for a fight. Clever players may find what they need there without throwing a punch, but something interesting is bound to happen.

boardgame.name: Quiet Places
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two unusually quiet dungeons:

In The Lost City of Zirzuzza aka The Quiet Place--which takes place deep in the desert that covers The Scorpion Lands--the party will discover a city long abandoned. One of the abandoned palaces contains a great treasure, but the party must navigate a strange mechanism to acquire it.

The Polder lies deep within any larger dungeon of the game-master’s choosing. Although the effects of visiting The Polder are wildly unpredictable, it is perfectly safe--but this in itself might frighten a party away.

boardgame.name: Crawling Lake and The Ghost Army
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features two and a half adventures:

Crawling Lake is a short scenario that leads up to The Test -- one of those massive pain-in-the-ass dungeons designed by insane wizards to test adventurers,

The Ghost Army is a thorny but simple scenario involving trickery and intrigue which puts the party at the center of a (potential?) battle between three armies.

boardgame.name: F***ing Bards
Fucking Bards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Bidwall Claspit (Specialist Level 5) Thin-lipped and narrow, this former royal architect’s assistant was fired in disgrace after he was discovered using his specialized knowledge of the palace to purloin the queen’s collection of tortoiseshell combs for purposes unknown. He now attempts to make a living as a flautist—a career for which he is ill-suited, despite a winning disposition."

This all-text installment of Cube World was boiled up from the charred remains of a project that never saw the light of day: “Bards”--a semi-serious book that Lamentations of the Flame Princess head James Edward Raggi IV commissioned about the worst character class in all fantasy because he has a bad sense of humor and hates me.

Five pages of jokes and 11 pages of actually useful stuff, the Troubadour class was previously published on this blog but the rest is new.

boardgame.name: Defense of the Ruined City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This installment of Cube World features an adventure in the Lands of the Southern Daimyos where the players are put in charge of an entire army. They must simultaneously direct their forces in battle as well as locate and take on the ferocious Onibaba herself--commander of the enemy forces.

boardgame.name: Evil City-State Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve got your swords, you’ve got your sorcery, you’ve got your mighty-thewed warrior, you’ve got your diamond-eyed monkey idol of Chuul, but you know what you still need? An evil city-state.

There has to be a place where a man with a pointy hat and yet pointier beard points from the top of a pointy tower and tells something from the cover of a pulp magazine to eat your players. That’s an important thing. In fact, if fantasy fiction is to be believed, you need lots of them.

You need several iterations of a small, local, evil place, so here you go.

boardgame.name: I Just Need a Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I just need a dungeon.

All my friends are coming–in half an hour and I have nothing. Nothing at all.

They need a dungeon. Something where four to five friends can comfortably duel and dwell for an afternoon.

Here it is: three easy-to-run dungeons, one map. One with goblins and dwarves, one with a crazy wizard, one underwater, They’ll do the trick.

These dungeons can be at the bottom of a long stair leading down from the surface or they can be parts of larger dungeons.

boardgame.name: Nepenthe
boardgame.description:
You won't need a haircut where you're going... mostly because you're bald. Inspired by Earthbound, Undertale, and other alt-RPGs, Nepenthe is a hand-drawn game made of dad-jokes and existential dread. Also cookies. Lots of cookies.

Source: Steam.

boardgame.name: Shadow Ninja: Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
Evil mists have corrupted the people. Chaos is everywhere. Can you make it in time to the source of the chaos before everything gets consumed by evil? On your way there will be many obstacles and rogue ninjas. Dodge these obstacles and get to the source of evil so that it can be stopped!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Kobold Caves of the Golden God
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Delve deep into the Mountains of Fire to solve the mystery of torturous screams echoing across the valley. Within the depths you will find kobolds, slimes, and the dying quest of a long-lost paladin order!

This module, in its original incarnation, was originally used for the 2021 B/X Blackrazor Year of the Rat Dungeon Contest. It has been altered and expanded upon in this volume. It is free of licensing and may be shared, modified, and altered as you wish

boardgame.name: Bloodfist Champions
boardgame.description:
Battle in league 5 vs 5 Arena matches, every-man-for-himself Battle Royale matches, or tour the world with your friends in 3 games in 1 box with Bloodfist Champions. Bloodfist Champions allows for multiple ways to play.

The original game, Bloodfist Champions', allows players to choose their fighting forces from 45 different teams, each with its own completely unique characters and style of play. Players battle through a league style setting, with each match awarding them experience points and gold for their team.

Bloodfist Champions: Battle Royale pits up to 30 players, each controlling one character, in a massive winner-take-all bout. It includes the same experience points and gold gains as the original, but focus is narrowed to what helps one player in the arena, rather than worrying about a whole team.

Bloodfist Champions: RPG is a tabletop roleplaying game in the world of Bloodfist, allowing players to experience the rich world as a group of traveling Bloodfist players, either as a team or as individual Battle Royale players (or both).

All of this mayhem runs on a system of dice involving uniquely illustrated six-sided attack dice. You roll to attack your enemy, and, if successful, roll again to see if you hurt him. Any time you hit an opponent hard enough to hurt him in any way, you earn, 1, 2, 3, or 5 experience points for the player who performed it, and the same amount of points are scored toward victory for your team (or individual in Battle Royale).

boardgame.name: Conductor: Stories from the Underground Railroad
boardgame.description:
In this solitaire roll-and-write game, you’ll become a conductor on the Underground Railroad, shepherding a party of self-emancipated fugitive slaves on a flight to freedom.

Designer's note: These rules apply to the standard form of the game. The system is designed to support scenarios representing individual slave narratives. Each may modify these basic rules. Played together, they offer a survey of this important literary genre, and the personal histories it sought to depict.

A game about fugitive slavery is not to be taken lightly. My intention has been to represent something of the experience of slave narratives in ludic form. I have approached my subject not as a trivial pursuit, but as an effort to explore how games may represent the most serious parts of our past. In this spirit, I invite you to play and share your thoughts.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: SHASN: Rome 40 BCE – Fall of the Republic
boardgame.description: This Campaign deck with Rome 40 BCD theme, change the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of ancient Rome.

boardgame.name: SHASN: Earth 2040 – The Future of Humanity
boardgame.description: This Campaign deck with the Earth 2040 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the hypothetical politics of the near future

boardgame.name: Carnival Carnage
boardgame.description:
This is a carnival-themed set collection card game with take-that elements.

—user summary

Be the first to collect a full set of carnival cards - they could be anything from acrobats to animals, rides to sideshows. But keep your wits about you because things can take an unexpected turn at the carnival and the carnage cards are there to wreak weird and wonderful havoc!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: SHASN: India 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
boardgame.description: This campaign deck, with an Indian elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern India.

boardgame.name: SHASN: USA 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
boardgame.description: This Campaign deck with the US elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern US.

boardgame.name: SHASN: UK 2019-20 – Brexit
boardgame.description: This Campaign deck with the Brexit referendum in the UK theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern UK.

boardgame.name: Triads
boardgame.description:
The Oryius titans of war dropped into the atmosphere of Bengall II. Planetary orbital fire screeched in vain as the Oryius forces were dropping short of their range. Thunderous echoes reverberate as the giant mechanized robots, or “mecha”, hit the ground. Although wise to avoid dropping directly into the city, the forces of Bengal II were now alerted to their presence. Forces were moving to intercept.

Triads uses counters and traditional wargaming gameplay to simulate robotic combat of the future. Players choose a team of three triads of mechanized robots. Each member of a triad can work independently but gain their greatest strength working as a team.

The objective is to destroy your opponents robot forces.

boardgame.name: SHASN: Game board for 2-3 players
boardgame.description:
A 2 player version of the original game.

SHASN is a political strategy board game where every player takes on the role of a politician in the midst of a political campaign. With each turn, players must draw an Ideology Card and take stands on divisive and urgent political issues. These choices will help them gather resources to influence voters or purchase strategic powers. Players can build diverse Ideologies with every policy decision, to best reflect their beliefs and play style. As they progress in the game, players must choose between sticking to their ideals or molding them as per their needs. In a game of trading, coercion, and strategy, players must do whatever it takes to survive and dominate.

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Castle of Emperor Zinn
boardgame.description:
The riches inside Emperor Zinn's castle are as numerous as the rumors of what else lies inside. Deadly traps are to be expected...but a minotaur in a maze?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Boise is Brighter
boardgame.description: it was a vintage Monopoly clone with properties showing the businesses and buildings of Boise, Id.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Junior Achievement Company of Defiance, Ohio

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Muckelf Swamp
boardgame.description:
The goblin bandits and the muckelves who dwell in the swamp are constantly fighting. Just passing through, you are caught in the middle. Neither side cares.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Omni TCG
boardgame.description:
Within Omni, a realm of constant flux, there stands massive Relics of unknown origins. These Monoliths, the Gate Crystals, are the source of all existence in Omni. From them, Souls manifest and engage in battle for complete omnipotence. Enhance your Souls with Quirks which provide unique abilities and allow them to ascend into Entities of considerable power. Change the tides of battle with Events that become reality through the magic of these Crystals. Be wary! When one of these great Monoliths shatters and falls upon itself, the gate of creation closes with it. Wage war against other crystal wielders; use your mighty Gate Crystals and their adaptable creations to claim Omni for your own!

Game starts with players selecting a Soul from their Existence deck ("Monster" pool) to begin the battle, placing one crystal on their board, and drawing three cards from their Standard deck (Event and Quirk deck). During a player's turn, they can improve their Souls by equipping Quirks and eventually Ascending them into Entities, by meeting the required EvoVal points for the Entity chosen (determined by Quirks' cumulative EvoVals). Players may also play "Stabilizers" or "Destabilizers" (Omni's equivalent to "Spells and Traps") that will have an immediate impact on the gameplay. There are no "Deck Outs" in Omni - simply reshuffle the Standard deck and continue play. Once all of a player's Crystals or Souls are destroyed, they have lost the game. They may also surrender at any point.

boardgame.name: Biergarten (Second edition)
boardgame.description:
In Biergarten, players compete to create the most beautiful Biergartens before Oktoberfest. Each turn, players will draw one tile from the supply, the open market, or randomly from another player's hand, then play one tile to expand their Biergarten and score points. Players score points by playing tiles that have matching colors, linking up umbrellas, and walling off their Biergarten. The player with the most points by the time Oktoberfest rolls around wins!

The game includes 76 beautifully illustrated tiles for players to choose from to truly make their Biergartens unique.

This second edition of Biergarten introduces all-new art, upgraded components, and new ways to play, including a solo mode.

Prost!

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Rock N Roll Spy
boardgame.description:
Your next mission takes you back in time to Benny’s Diner, the most hopping malt shop in the 1950’s. At first, this mission may look like a breeze. There are poodle skirts, a juke box, and the fanciest cars you have ever seen. However, this diner holds a secret, which only the wisest can uncover. Benny, the owner and a local celebrity, has known connections to the Soviet Union and we think it just might be possible that he may be none other than a Russian spy! You have an hour to sneak into the diner, discover the secrets, and figure out what Benny knows before he returns. Good luck!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Murder in the Forgotten Tomb
boardgame.description: In the 1920’s the excavation of ancient tombs was all the rage, especially after Howard Carter discovered the tomb of King Tut. There were many other teams of archaeologists in the Valley of the Kings who were not so lucky, however. We’ve been called back to check on the whereabouts of a team of explorers who have gone missing while on the search for one of the biggest archaeological discoveries of all time. You have heard that the tomb was cursed, for many who enter meet grisly ends soon after. Upon entering it yourself, you begin to believe it. The professor in charge of the search has been murdered, his body mummified in the depths of the tunnels. You have one hour to search the passageways, discover the codes, and find the clues to determine “whodunnit” before you too become another cursed intruder in the forgotten tomb.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Titanic
boardgame.description:
In our most dangerous mission yet, you will be asked to board the infamous Titanic in a daring rescue attempt. The ship is already beginning to angle into the water, but your team has been tasked to head deep into the bowels of the ship to save an agent and to recover a cursed object which may have brought about the disaster. Split up to explore the elegance of the first class staterooms or take your chances in the already flooded 3rd class bunks as you gather objects to complete the mission. Remember, however…. there were not enough life boats on board and time is rushing away. Can you escape the unsinkable ship?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: The Sinking of the Titanic

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Silver Screen
boardgame.description:
The worst fears of your boss have come true. Someone has discovered time travelers and has made a movie about your adventures... a movie soon to be released to the world as a blockbuster. This simply will not do...so your team has one simple mission. Stop the movie from being released at all costs. Sneak into the movie studio in old Hollywood and sabotage the production without being discovered. Hurry, the filming resumes soon! Do you have what it takes to bring production to a halt? Lights, Camera, Action...

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Outlaw
boardgame.description:
After causing a massive change to history, you need to prove your worth to your boss at the time traveling agency. The easiest way to regain his trust is to hunt down a time traveling object lost back in the Old West and return it to the present. The only issue is that a band of outlaws have already found the item and plan to defend it with their lives. It is up to you as to how you proceed. Partner with the law to hunt down the outlaws and put them to justice... or join the gang and steal the item from under their noses. Either way, it is up to you to recover the item... even if it comes to a shootout.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Stellar Evolution
boardgame.description:
Stellar Evolution is a game of strategy set in a distant future where mankind makes its home among the stars. Choose a race and select your fleet from the varied units available to you before leading them into battle against another player. Destroy enemy forces and capture key strategic ships in order to become the ultimate victor.

The game takes place on a square grid. The game takes place over turns, meaning that one player moves all their ships and takes all their actions before announcing their turn is at an end and the next player begins their turn. The game ends if one player destroys all opposing forces or automatically after every player has had 10 turns.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sacred Forge
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Everyone who is part of the story touches Destiny in some way. Even if they are not the heroes. Even if they are not even named in the pages.

You are a master bladesmith, the keeper of the Sacred Forge. Your blades are renowned for their strength, sharpness, and harmony.

A holy sword does not come from nowhere. It does not materialize from starlight and a wish. It is built through effort, honed through attention, and consecrated by a powerful heart.

They will not name you in the story. But your blade will never be forgotten.

boardgame.name: Sapling Soul
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a Sapling Soul. You belong to the Forest but the Forest does not belong to you. The Forest is bigger than you in more ways than one, and you regard it with awe.

Most days you lead an average life, not so different to your peers. But some days you hear the Forest call and you answer. Always you answer.

Tonight the Forest calls to you again. There are always mysterious creatures in the Forest, but tonight something is amiss. There is a newcomer who may cause trouble. You are a Sapling Soul, you are called to help.

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Lair of Lawnadynn
boardgame.description:
The tunnels are a network of confusion. Lawnadynn, the seducer, is aware of your presence. Her ensnared minions await to ambush you. Can you both overcome evil and resist?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Crypts of Rojosh
boardgame.description:
The dark legacy of Rojosh is a tale that few dare to tell. The unholy works of the jaded cleric caused entire nations to perish. Why are you going into his crypt?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Varda
boardgame.description:
A mysterious and adventurous journey from the bottom of the dark soil to the light of crystal flagons and a wonderful and stunning evolution from some simple flower to a prestigious essence!
The original Iranian board game, Varda, is the winner of the 1st prize of “Land of Beautiful Mind” game designing contest and an exciting strategy game which uses the process of planting flowers and producing “Golab” (The Persian Rose-Water) to make a great challenge and puts the players in the role of farmers and craftsmen who try to plant the best shrubs and flowers in the most fertile soils and upgrade their technology to produce the most aromatic “Golab”s and most precious essences…
But be careful, in the breathtaking industry of “Golab”, there is no trace of flowers’ delicacy!

In Varda, you’re farmers who should cultivate the best Damask Roses in your lands and produce the best Golab (Persian Rose-Water), Strong Golab and Essences.

You should send your workers (meeples) to 4 different areas of the board: Planting Area, Floriculture Area, Extracting Area and Technology Area.
At the beginning, a Year card is revealed. This card determines the capacity of each area for placing meeples, based on the number of players and shows the events of the beginning of the year and the end of the year, based on the rainfall amount.
Each game may be played in several years so be prepared for any upcoming events!

Blue meeples can only be placed in Planting and Floriculture areas and the Green ones can only be placed in Extracting and Technology Areas. Pink meeples are the most valuable meeples; You can place them in any area (even ignoring that area’s capacity) and use them to obtain Event cards so take care of them!

After all players placed their meeples on the board, you should do the actions of the different areas by removing the meeples from the board and placing them in Resting Space.

Expand your farm and obtain the needed resources (Water, Light and Fertilizer) to have the best harvest. The Lands with special powers need more resources but help your achieve the products sooner.

Cultivate Saplings and harvest your lands and produce the best Damask-Rose products. You can develop your technology and gain new facilities, paying its price!

After all actions were resolved, take the meeples from the Resting Area as you wish and depending on your strategy, in clockwise order, starting with the First Player. Your choices would affect the others’ play!

As a beginner, you can play Varda without the Event cards which give you combinatory actions and special abilities and add them to the game only when you got enough experiences!

The winner is the player who can produce the best and more precious Golab and Essences before the rivals, develop their technology more than the rivals and reach their goals.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Land of Beautiful Mind (سرزمین ذهن زیبا)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dogfight
boardgame.description:
A real time team based competitive game where two bi-planes operated by dogs try to shoot each other out of the sky.

During alternating timed and resolution phases, players have to quickly communicate with their team-mate to play up to 4 cards between them without showing their hands, and without giving away too much of their strategy to the other team.

If you can hit the enemy plane, that team will lose cards from their decks until one player runs out completely, and that plane is shot down.

boardgame.name: Kuflikupac
boardgame.description:
Maybe you know the seven kufliks: Zödön, Bélabá, Pofánka, Valér, Tituszt, Hilda and Fityirc, who live in the kufli-heap, in the meadow. They just play and relax all the day. Play with them too! Make a kufli-heap alone, play with the kufli-memory game or the kufli-collector game. If you are a good tactician, buy the kufli-heap cards from the other players and be the first who mades his whole kufli-heap.


Ugye, te is ismered a hét kuflit, Zödönt, Bélabát, Pofánkát, Valért, Tituszt, Hildát és Fityircet, akik az elhagyatott réten laknak a kuflikupacban, és egész nap csak játszanak és heverésznek? Most játssz te is velük! Rakd ki egyedül a kuflikupacot, játssz a kuflimemorival és a kufligyűjtögetővel, vagy taktikázz ügyesen, és vedd meg a többiektől a kufliüreged darabjait a leghamarabb! A kicsik kedvencei – kicsit másképp!

boardgame.name: Mein Körper: Das Quiz
boardgame.description:
Why does our hair turn gray? How many chambers does the heart consist of? What causes tooth decay? Our body is a miracle! Mein Körper - Das Quiz (= my body, the quiz amazes and amuses, and lets young and old quizmasters prove how well they know the human body. The quiz game contains everything children want to know about our organs, bones, and cells, as well as the exciting processes of human life. There are also plenty of unbelievable facts and crazy stories.

Each player draws a card from each of the different categories. The youngest player starts and turns over one of the cards from their own little pile. If it is a solo card, the question may only be answered alone. If the answer is correct, the card may be kept. If it is a chance card, all players may guess the right answer. The player who comes up with the correct answer the fastest receives the card. The goal of the game is to be the first to play out all the cards from your own pile and collect more correctly answered cards than the other players.

boardgame.name: Das Feel Good Spiel
boardgame.description:
Das Feel Good Spiel is a card-based game that is all about expressing affection and appreciation for your loved ones by answering the questions on the cards. The game helps to create a conscious moment for compliments and nice words.

The small cards support players in finding the right expressions and give ideas for different topics they want to highlight with compliments. The game is not about winning or losing, but solely about positive vibes and the players' well-being. In the course of the game, the players compliment each other and express their mutual appreciation in a creative way. On 100 cards, there are numerous ideas for kind words, encouragement and compliments.


In each round, one person receives compliments from their fellow players.
One person draws a card with a compliment idea and reads it aloud.
The other players add their own personal compliment and write it on a piece of paper.
Afterwards, all compliments are read aloud.


The game can be played with in a variation where each player has to guess who wrote down what and receives one point per correct guess. Whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Orc Massage
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





User Summary

You are an Orc who moved to the city and become an honest massage therapist - but unfortunately some of your clients gets turned on by your firm touch - help the orc: Stay professional or allow to be seduced by the clients...

boardgame.name: Katedra Koszmarów
Nightmare Cathedral
boardgame.description:
Nightmare Cathedral prominently features the haunting artwork by the late polish surrealist painter and sculptor Zdzisław Beksiński.

Nightmare Cathedral is a strategy game for 1–4 players, where victory is gained by controlling the map, managing resources, following objectives and selecting when to engage in fast and furious conflicts to gain strategic advantage. Over the course of the game, you will perform actions — and follow the actions of other players — to produce units, build fortifications, maneuver around the map, and spend your followers to climb the ritual track. Throughout the game, a haunting Cathedral will grow in the center of the board, and once it is completed, you will face — and gain the ability to control! — the physical manifestations of nightmares that are released upon the world. Nightmare Cathedral is a game of both strategy and tactics, where finding clever ways to follow your objectives and combining different strategies is the ultimate route to victory.

Each player has a set of Action cards. These Action cards display various effects that may be activated either on that player's own turn, or as a reaction when other players perform that action. When you are the Active Player, you will move your Dreamer to a Day space that is not adjacent to its current Night space and perform the Action associated with that Day space, as outlined on your own Action card.
Inactive Players may react to your chosen Day Action.

The game is divided into two stages. During the first stage, the titular Nightmare Cathedral is built, piece by piece, as the game progresses. Once the final Cathedral piece is placed on the main board, the Nightmare Cathedral is finished, at which point the game transitions to the second stage. From this moment on, Nightmares, powerful beings channeling the presence of the completed Cathedral, enter the game board, Devouring Units in their path. However, as a player, you may also take actions to control a Nightmare, Commanding it to do your bidding.

The game end is triggered in one of the following ways:


The Time marker reaches a certain space on the Time track.
A single player reaches the final step of the Ritual track.
A certain number of Units have been devoured.

listing.notes:
New PREORDER
Final sale. KS delays common

boardgame.name: Varia: Starter Set – Volcanic Warrior & Shadow Assassin
boardgame.description:
The Varia Starter Set is a card & dice dueling game where players select from one of two fantasy-themed classes. Players take turns planning out a course of action before rolling dice to see whose tactics come out on top. By using a combination of weapons, armor, and cards in hand, players create a plan of attack (or response to an incoming attack) each turn. The goal is to knock the other player’s health points to zero through clever card combinations, while simultaneously preventing your own defeat by planning tactical defensive moves.

Gameplay is divided into two major phases. The planning phase sees players laying out their actions for the turn, which represent attacks and blocks that the players will perform. The resolution phase has players rolling combinations of dice as dictated by the cards they played in the planning phase in order to determine what attacks hit or miss, and what damage (if any) is dealt or avoided.

The starter set includes: Volcanic Warrior & Shadow Assassin.

listing.notes: Played once. Contact me for shipping costs.

boardgame.name: Anderian Adventures: Return to Hope
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fourth in a series of adventures for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition, set in the Fantasy Kingdom of Anderia. The game is set in the areas between Gengorge and the second city of Hope as the characters travel on a mission that sets them against the forces of the Chaos Masters and allies them with Cardinal, Lord Mayor and Grandmasters of the Fighting Orders.

The game is for a group of established adventurers who are just starting out. 4th - 6th Level. As the series progresses the characters will have the chance to make powerful allies and more than a few enemies too. Magick and ancient powers will come into play as the group attempt to thwart the plot of a powerful mastermind bent on bringing back something that should never have existed.

boardgame.name: Outbreak: Undead Second Edition - Annual Volume One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You helped us to revive this community favorite Free Content Friday content line through outstanding support on Kickstarter. You actively participated in the revival by submitting your own creations alongside those of industry veterans and our own development team. You've collected the free versions bit by bit over the course of the year.

This revival of the Hunters Entertainment tradition of Free Content Friday means that the Annual is back!

The Outbreak: Undead.. 2nd Edition Annual marks the first collaboration between the developers and the fans and is quite possibly the best edition of the annual yet made!

In this edition you will find...
• New opponent types
• A cast of non-player characters to use
• Mini campaigns
• Unique missions
• An update of an old favorite One Big Monster reimagined as an entire scenario, The Lords of the Wasteland!

...and a host of other surprises released throughout the 2018-2019 run of Free Content Friday.

boardgame.name: Outbreak: Undead Second Edition - Annual Volume Two
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another year of amazing content, the longest and most helpful release since we’ve ever started publishing over ten years ago! Not only will you see an example of a scenario from start to finish, you will see all new ones.

The Outbreak: Undead.. Second Edition Annual marks yet another successful collaboration between the developers and the fans and it is our proudest annual so far!

In this edition you will find...
• A full scenario walkthrough
• A previously unreleased finale to the scenario “The Old Man and the Z”
• Unique missions

...and a host of other surprises released throughout the 2020 run of Free Content Friday.

boardgame.name: Agents and Alehouses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within these pages lie four unique NPCs and drinking establishments to add flavor to your game and give potential hooks for your adventurers to follow.

Argentum is the perfect example of the goblin race, with needle-like teeth and glowing yellow eyes. He is constantly heard muttering in Dwarven as he works the forge and exclaims sayings such as “By Dwerfater’s Forge!” and “I swear it on my beard!”
Belladonna is a waifish young woman, no older than 13. She has russet hair and dirty skin with eyes like pooled amber.
The Dandy is an immaculately dressed elderly gentleman with shoulder length golden blond hair and eyes full of childlike wonder. He sits behind a rich mahogany counter in a storefront that seems lifted directly from a noble’s home.
Ignacio is a thin shoony with white fur and golden spots that stands a mere 3 feet tall. He wears studded leather armor that is covered in alchemist’s fire and other explosives that jostle violently due to his constant shivering
The Black Dragon is a ramshackle building that seems to be built of driftwood and smells strongly of peat. A single scarred man named Roger works the bar in a sweat stained shirt that he uses to clean the mugs before pouring drinks.
The Hag’s Head is an extravagant dancing hall holds a variety of taxidermized creatures, including many humanoids. The prize of the collection, a stuffed night hag, greets customers at the front door alongside a chipper changeling in a dazzling black dress who calls herself Night Noir.
Molly and Mead is a washboard white building with a barn red roof bearing a simple written sign hanging over the door. Three shoony wait tables within, with a green haired gnome wearing hempen clothing behind the bar.
The Seven Points seems to have been grown out of the tree that holds it and has no sign, simply a seven-pointed star on the door and every window. It smells of morning dew and the staff are all hauntingly beautiful.

boardgame.name: Mondrian: Color in Motion
boardgame.description:
Mondrian: Color in Motion is a game where players take turns placing cards, overlapping other cards either partially or completely, based on colors. As cards are placed, tokens are added where they overlap. Later, players may jump tokens to claim them and earn points.

Players can play solo, attempting to top their own high score, or they can play with up to 4 other people. When playing with others, players may play through the entire deck, or to a set number of points if a shorter game is desired.

Each turn consists of three phases:
Card Placement: Each card has three squares. When placing the card, at least one square must overlap an already placed card. All overlaps must be of the same color. Additionally, will filling an empty area, colors must match adjacent colors.
Next, each square that is overlapped has a token placed on it. These represent points, but they don't belong to anyone yet.
After tokens have been placed, players jump tokens to capture them for themself. Jumps can be in any direction, including diagonals.
Finally, a player ends their turn by drawing a card.

The game ends either when a predetermined score has been reached, or the draw pile is empty.

boardgame.name: Girl Talk: Sassy Sticks
boardgame.description:
Girl Talk games are all about getting together with your friends and having fun. Sure, there's a way to win if you want to be competitive, but there's also room for plenty of LOL moments in each game so you can just sit back, chill out and have a great time with the girls.

Who’s got the best answer? Pick a stick with a question on it and roll the dice to “fill in” the missing word. Then, think up a good answer to the question based on the kind of answer the die asks for — whether it’s silly, weird, true or anything else!

The best answer gets a ring. The person who collects the most rings, wins!

boardgame.name: The Amok
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

BOYS AND GIRLS, IT'S KILLING TIME!

A couple months ago, rumor pulled itself across the Wasteland, one clawed hand at a time, until it reached farms around Scrapbridge and spewed warnings about some new @#$# stomping around and killing sh@t in the north. A new band showed up and started making serious problems for the Wastelanders. And now it’s inching its way south toward Scrapbridge.

Who are these #@$%? The Amok. Some folks know them as the Savages, Reavers, Gone, and the Defilers. Whatever you want to call them, they’re the only ones who got out of Liberty City alive after the megalopolis flipped tits-up. And now they’re looking for new meat to sate their hunger for blood and death.

The Amok presents a new faction of foes for your teams to fight in the Wasteland. Here, you’ll find details on their origins, several examples of their members, and hooks for using them in your games. Blah, blah, blah, usual bullshit sales text. You know the drill. Buy this or don't.

boardgame.name: Dracula: Walpurgis Night
boardgame.description:
Walpurgis Night is upon us and, as is traditional, Count Dracula invites his subjects to celebrate with him in his castles. As his loyal servant, you are tasked with picking up his guests and conveying them to their intended destinations. You will also have to pick up his subjects, each in their own coffin, and convey them to the castles without delay. Carry out your duties efficiently and swiftly and beware of the perils lurking in the shadows!

Transport as many passengers in your coach as you can to their chosen destination. They will give you coins for your services and provide food for the vampires. You will need the coins to discreetly transport the coffins on your coach and to buy protections for your journeys.

Whenever you drop off guests at their chosen destination, they will leave blood tokens which the vampires (coffins) in the local castle will feed on … but so, too, will any werewolf in that area.

When Count Dracula appears (end of the round), the werewolves and vampires will feed on the innocent travellers. The more blood tokens there are in an area, the more food there will be for the vampires, and the more victory points (VP) you will gain (you only gain VP for coffins of your own colour).
