Title: Dracula: Walpurgis Night Publisher: Invedars Language(s): English German French Spanish

boardgame.name: OSR Rosetta Stone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So many versions of Dungeons and Dragons! Wouldn't it be easy if there was a one page conversion guide?

There is!

boardgame.name: Gimme That!
boardgame.description:
In this potato-themed party game, you win by being the first player to write the number 100 while counting potatoes on the sheet in front of you. The catch: there's only one pencil for the entire group to use when tallying up their taters.

The game starts with one person writing while the rest of the circle takes turns rolling the die. Most of the options rolled cause you to give everyone else a goofy gesture (a "high-fry" all-in hand slap, a "mashed potatoes" table drum roll, or a "spud-bump" simultaneous fist pound). But one of the die rolls will cause everyone to pass their potato-counting papers to the left, making the pencil-marker start where their neighbor left off, and giving someone else a big head start. And one of the die rolls will cause the roller to reach for the pencil and exclaim, "Gimme That!"
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Gimme That

boardgame.name: ISO
boardgame.description:
In ISO you will delve into a world of isometry where you will compete against your opponets for the completion of objectives in one of the 3 different perspectives.

It is for 1-3 players and lasts about 5-10 minutes per game, and it will most definitely be testing your conception of space and perspective. Control the three dimensions and be a step ahead of your opponents intentions to achieve the victory, or enjoy a rewarding cooperative challenge together.

Players will take turns playing the topmost tile of the pile, with the purpose of claiming some of the revealed objectives and not letting the other players claim them when their turns arrive. As soon as all tiles are placed, the game will end and the player with most points will be the winner.

May your eyes don´t play tricks on you while at it :)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Wreckland Run: Fallout
boardgame.description:
Welcome back to the Wreckland. You've made quite a name for yourself on your past runs, but there is always room for growth and new threats appear from out of the wastes every day. These new enemies are bringing new TOXIC weapons into play, sure to slow down your carnage. But you've also been outfitted with new MISSILE weapons, capable of long-range damage. New vehicles, new enemies, new bosses... time to run AGAIN!

The Fallout expansion is expanded content for Wreckland Run. It includes 1 campaign book adding 3 chapters to the campaign, 2 vehicle mats, 2 pilot cards, 6 upgrade cards, 9 parts cards, 9 enemy cards, 3 new bosses, and 9 green "toxic" gems.

boardgame.name: Yakalaï
boardgame.description:
Yakalaï is a cooperative role-playing game that takes you to fantastic lands. You must cooperate, survive and gain experience in order to complete your quest. No need for a passionate game master. The players, guided by the cards, take turns fulfilling this function.

Each turn, you turn over a card, decide to travel there, or not, follow the instructions. To resolve the events, just roll the dice. When you arrive at the end of the last card, you succeed the adventure. If you survive, that is.

Easy to access Yakalaï allows you a quick introduction to the mechanics of role-playing games. The 4 character classes and 36 event cards will create a multitude of situations for you that will challenge even the most seasoned adventurers.

boardgame.name: Trickerion: Dawn of Technlology – Zorniger Geist Promo
boardgame.description:
Promo Card for Trickerion: Dawn of Technlology - "Raging Spirit"
(Promo-Karte für Trickerion: Erwachen der Technik - "Zorniger Geist")

Type: Spiritual

Prepare Action Point cost: 2
Trick Marker Slot: 3
Symbol Marker Slot: Circle

Fame Threshold: 36

Wildcard Bonus (Lvl 3 only)

Components needed: Padlock, 2 Rope, 3 Metal

boardgame.name: Bandits Below!
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

Second installment includes a store front for a bandit group which can be set in any large city or even in more rural areas.

Be sure to check out our other recent releases, for 5e, an overhauled background system to make characters more verasatile!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Tower of Saxon
boardgame.description:
The Tower of Saxon has been left alone for ages. Some think it was taken over by dark machinations, others think it is cursed. They are both right.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Mountains of Zokar
boardgame.description:
The inhospitable mountains are patrolled by numerous actions. Armies cannot make their way though without a fight...but perhaps a lone wolf could.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Caverns of Grot
boardgame.description:
Grot's tunnels curve and confuse as creatures lurk and linger. Some attack out of instinct, but others seem to be aware of you. Grot's Ogre-Magi knows you are coming.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Roads of Tonar
boardgame.description:
The Roads of Tonar connect all the cities and villages in the land. If you have a destination in mind, the Road of Tonar will take you there. Don't expect to be alone.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Deck of Deadly Things
boardgame.description:
You angrily snatch the jester's deck. He twiddles his thumbs as you open it. Drawing the first card, you hear his taunting laugh as you are transported into the Elsewhere. You feel the chaos surround you.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Ultimate Treehouse
boardgame.description:
Ultimate Treehouse is a game of building and strategy for ages 7 and up.

Each player starts with a beautiful blank tree mat and builds a treehouse full of fun classics. The first one to have 6 elements in their treehouse wins. Player on player cards allow you to slow down your opponents, helper cards will allow you advantages and disaster cards may slow you down.

On your turn you draw cards and then can do one of three actions; build, play a card or draw again. To build you use material cards from your hand like lumber, nails and metal to build parts of the treehouse. The game ends when you have 6 elements in your treehouse- 3 required elements and any other three you choose.

boardgame.name: Bible Brawl: End Times Expansion
boardgame.description:
The End Times Expansion Pack adds 30 more cards to be used with your base game of Bible Brawl.

This expansion pack draws inspiration from stories and characters from the book of Daniel and Revelation. From a seven-headed red dragon to a minion of the Locust King Abbadon, you never know what you are going to pick up next.

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Omega Forever
boardgame.description:
Omega Now, Omega Forever! When the Morphin Grid was shattered, its energy empowered individuals across the galaxy. In Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Omega Forever, you can play as one of the powerful Omega Rangers or the dangerous Anointed.

Both sides bring new cards and mechanisms to the fight! Cavotus, for example, is the only villain that can actually flip to his empowered side without having all of his attachments slots filled (and watch out when he does!), while the Rangers can make use of their new Omega Coins to temporarily flip to their Ranger side, or can use the coin when already morphed to trigger additional effects!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Zeo: Stronger Than Before

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Ruins (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

boardgame.name: The Longest Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

How many times must we witness a hapless group of aspiring ghost hunters spend a night in a “haunted” house before we accept it for the cheap source of jump scares and bottled hysteria that it is?

These places house no ghosts. These people know nothing of the undead. These “ghost hunters” do not understand real fear.

Well, now they’re coming to my house, and I feel it’s high time someone put a damn good fright into the impetuous living.

Who knows? Maybe before the night’s out, they’ll join the ranks of the dead, and keep me permanent company.

The Longest Night includes:

A condensed version of the Storyteller System for use in any World of Darkness 20th Anniverary game.
A full chronicle taking ghost hunters from their arrival at an old, haunted house, through to their departure — as living or dead — the morning after. Perfect for a one-shot or convention play.
A selection of ready-made characters, all playable straight from the pages of this book.

boardgame.name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – Ramparts of the Empire
boardgame.description:
Okko Chronicles - Ramparts of the Empire features the legendary Rônin and his fellow travelers who, taking refuge in strongholds scattered throughout the mountains, must fend off the countless invading armies of Karasu before they breach the Pajan.
During a game, each player will choose to embody one of the Heroes. Together, they will have to make the best decisions to ensure that the fortress can withstand the repeated assaults of the undead.

Okko Chronicles - Ramparts of the Empire can be played in cooperative or semi-cooperative mode:
In semi-cooperative mode, one of the players will play as Black Tiger, an evil ninja, a former hero corrupted by necromancy, who has infiltrated the fortress to facilitate the arrival of the Karasu era!
In cooperative mode, a deck of Black Tiger Reaction cards will allow you to make this dangerous opponent act.

During a turn, each player plays one or two of their action cards; these cards give them advantages to perform the 3 actions they have.

A game ends:
- when all the Heroes are put out of action or when one of the fortress walls gives way completely, leaving the Pajan Empire to the undead,
- or when the last wave of the Karasu army breaks on the defenses of the fortress, thanks to the arrival of the Pajan army.
But beware, other parallel objectives can also influence the course of the story.

The game is part of the same range as the Okko Chroicles Water Cycle. It can be considered as its sequel but the game mechanics are different and they can't be played together.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – The Long Quest

boardgame.name: Little Drawington: Halloween
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Little Drawington, a small sleepy village on a hill in the British countryside that prides itself on their beautiful gardens and friendly community. As the days get shorter and the leaves start to change, excitement rises in the village as they get to work on their autumn gardens for the Pumpkin Growing Contest. This year, the competition is extra fierce, there are strange rumours going around of unusual behaviour. It is the night before the grand jury comes by and you are not leaving anything to chance, calling upon dark forces from beyond to grow your pumpkin the biggest and even sabotaging your neighbours gardens.

Little Drawington: Halloween is a draw and draw game, where players draw cards with shapes they then get to draw on their own garden boards.

The game consists of 3 repeating phases and a final evaluation round The phases are: The Ghastly Growing Phase, the Creepy Carving Phase, and the Demonic Decoration Phase.

When the deck of root cards has run out, the sun rises and players add up their points. The player with the most points win. The garden boards look like little clipboards from the town council, so as players are creating their gardens they are also filling in what the garden looks like on a scoring form for the end of the game.

boardgame.name: From the Cellar: Pack 11
boardgame.description:
This issue includes 10 accompanying ETO scenarios that will take you from Dunkerque to the snow covered Russian winter, Italy or Walcheren island and the replacement countersheet for "The Green Hell of Inor", countersheet # 3.

The following scenarios are included:

FT304 - Loosening the noose: Notre Dame des Neiges, South of
Dunkerque, France, June 3rd 1940
FT305 - Kutrik: Kutrik, Volchov, Russia, April 2nd 1942
FT306 - Stalin’s Orders: Kolsovo, Russia, 28 July 1942
FT307 - Backstabbing Paratroopers: Svidovok, Russia , 13 November 1943
FT308 - Luchs: RudnIaweresnia, Russia, 9 December 1943
FT309 - Smoke on the Water: Acquafondata, Italy, 12 January 1944
FT310 - Back to the River: Dornot bridgehead, France, 8 September 1944
FT311 - Five-Oh-Sink: Outskirts of Eindhoven, Netherlands, 18 September 1944
FT312 - Near Dishoek, Walcheren island, 2 November 1944
FT313 - Sainte Barbe on Fire: Cité Sainte-Barbe, Wittenheim, France, 2 February 1945

boardgame.name: Ghosts Love Candy Too: More Ghosts Promo
boardgame.description:
This four pack set features new ghost card options that can be used by players.

The four ghosts (Chloe, Heather, Beckett, and Graydor) each have a set of 9 cards with each of the 1-9 values, for a total of 36 cards in the promo pack.

boardgame.name: Dracula: Fangs & Pitchforks
boardgame.description:
Dracula is a social deduction game. In Dracula all players are arguing for their life, convincing Dracula not to eat them while having a hidden agenda.

Welcome to Transylvania where the local Villagers have received the unwanted pleasure of joining Dracula for dinner.

One player will be the famous Count and the rest will be Villagers trying to convince Dracula that anyone else would make a better meal. Players will take turns using Excuse cards to craft their plea’s and take cues from Act cards to support their plea. But watch out, your fellow Villagers might stab you in the back using their Excuse cards to save their own skin!

The game ends, when all players have had their round as Dracula. All players count their Victory tokens. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Forest of Torment
boardgame.description:
There is a reason people do not venture into these lands. However, tales of an ancient civilization with wondrous artifact compels the boisterous and the foolhardy.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Ruins of Narr
boardgame.description:
The site smells of musty ancient lore. Light upon its depths reveal secrets that were meant to stay hidden away from the outside world. But why? Is there more to this than simply an ancient ruin?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Love is Blind
boardgame.description:
Score big on your next game night with Love is Blind. Inspired by the hit dating show on Netflix, you’ll secretly answer a series of questions and discover who could be your best match.

Players become couples as the proposals begin -- we provide the rings, you bring the courage! Say “Yes” in the Pods and retire to The Apartments, where newly formed power couples can strengthen their bond or run from the relationship. Earn Hearts by answering real-life questions and matching your partner’s answers. Are you a mismatch? Propose to another player whose relationship is on the ropes, and you’ll get a second chance at finding your true soulmate! The first couple to earn 9 Hearts wins and lives happily ever after... or at least until your next game night.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Cathedral of the Celestial
boardgame.description:
Historians have said that an ancient civilization once lived in this area. Those of religious orders would disagree, adding that these beings are not archaic, but eternal! Do mortals dare enter?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Zoltar's Sanctuary
boardgame.description:
The heretic has been diving into forces unknown. Strange happenings and disappearances have been noted in nearby villages. The only way to end it...is to end him.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Kellia: Das Wagnis eines Lebens in der Wüste
Kellia: El riesgo del desierto
Kellia: El risc del desert
Kellia: Het gevaar van de woestijn
Kellia: I rischi del deserto
Kellia: Le risque du désert
Kellia: O Risco do Deserto
Kellia: The Risk of the Desert
boardgame.description:
Kellia is a cooperative strategy game for 2 to 4 players.

Players work together to survive in the Egyptian desert and build their hermitages (kellions). Every turn, they start from their kellion at the edge of the board and wander into the desert to explore, build, and gather food and water to survive the night.

The turns have two phases: day and night. Each day, players have three actions, which they can use to move to an adjacent square (and reveal it, if it is face-down), get 'attention to nature' cubes by contemplating the desert, or spend cubes to either build their kellion, improve a resource square or construct a building or resource in the desert. Furthermore, they can exchange cubes with other players they meet or end their turn prematurely by begging for food or water at the church in the center of the board. Players can buy additional three actions by spending an 'inner life' cube. Due to the limited number of actions, turns have to be as well planned in advance as is possible with the hidden information.

During the night, players gain 'inner life' cubes and have to give away food and water. The players often need to cooperate: if one player fails to end the day with at least 1 food and 1 water, the game is lost for everybody. Before the next day starts, an incidence card affects the game: either a sand storm, famine or drought destroys or disables a part of the board, which is chosen randomly by rolling a dice, or bandits, fasting, or akedia affect the players.

The game ends, if one player has no food or water during a night (lost), all players built their kellion and survive the following night (won), or the 9th, 10th, or 11th day is passed without everybody having built their kellion (lost, the number of days depends on the 'difficulty' option).

Kellia is created and illustrated by the Brothers of the Taizé Community, which is inspired by the lives of the desert fathers and mothers. It combines spirituality, mutual help, and ecology.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: Caves of Dey'Lithia
boardgame.description:
Zoltar has undone something deep within the earth. A living society once trapped in stasis, now released by the mad wizard. Can what is done be undone?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Dungeonrunner: The Unknown Reaches
boardgame.description:
Dey'Lithia's ambition has been unveiled to be more than merely returning her people to the upper world. No. She wishes to exact revenge upon the gods themselves!

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

boardgame.name: Cross-Pollinator
boardgame.description:
BZ is a busy bee and needs your guidance to reach her hive.

Each garden has 36 patches on a 6x6 grid and there are two flowers on each flower bed patch.
BZ will fly, orthogonally, from one patch to another, as long as the two patches have one flower in common.
Note that BZ cannot be convinced to fly to a patch she has been before, since such patch has no pollen left.

Help BZ bring the most pollen to the hive by sunset.

Solve the longest path problem before the time runs out.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Crimewave
boardgame.description:
Denton City. A haven for some, a nightmare for others. Despite the police’s best efforts to keep control, crime is on the rise. The opportunity is here: it’s time for you to run this town, but you aren’t the only one trying to do so. If you keep yourself safe and your enemies at bay, the city will be yours…

Crimewave is a 2-6 player card game played in a series of rounds, each representing an instance of an ongoing turf war in Denton City.

In each round, players earn points by using the abilities of their cards or by having the card with the highest value once the draw deck is empty. On their turn, players draw a card and discard a card, resolving the card's effect as necessary.

As soon as one player has accumulated enough points, that player is declared Crime Lord of the city, allowing them to bask in the glory of their underworld power. We expect a full game of Crimewave to take 15 minutes per player, but players can also play to a higher point limit or even to a time limit instead.

boardgame.name: Gundalow Kids
boardgame.description:
Get ready to set sail!

Gundalow Kids is a simpler (but no less enjoyable) version of the Gundalow board game. Kids and parents will sail back into historical New England as captains of their own gundalows - flat-bottomed sailboats historically used for transporting cargo.

Players start the game in one of six towns in the Seacoast region near Portsmouth, New Hampshire. Each town has its own unique market of available and wanted goods, drawn from a deck of market cards. Players load goods onto their gundalows and then roll a die to sail to other towns. Event cards come into play when players land on the event squares on the game board. Event cards offer new challenges, opportunities, and rewards to players, as well as potential changes to the town markets.

Players earn money by successfully delivering goods to the towns before the other players. Exotic goods, such as spices and cotton, are worth more than locally-produced goods, but players need to make the long journey downriver to Portsmouth to access the more valuable commodities.

The objective of the game is for the players to deliver the goods needed by each town, and the game will end when each of the wanted goods spaces in the town markets is filled. The player who earns the most money wins the game!

For advanced players, the game also includes variants, including an option that provides honorary titles to the players who deliver the most of each good. With the rich variety of market and event cards, each game of Gundalow Kids is unique. The game provides an enjoyable window into the rich history of the Seacoast region.

boardgame.name: Worldwide Pandemic
boardgame.description: Terrorists have released a dangerous pathogen that has caused a pandemic. The authorities have discovered an encrypted laptop computer that contains the cure. However, no one terrorist knows the password. 12 terrorist around the world each have one clue to it. You must investigate cities around the world to capture these terrorists and get clues to the password. The pathogen is very virulent and you will have to quarantine cities to slow the spread in the meantime. However, quarantined cities may riot which could lead to more nearby cities being infected. You have 6 attempts to enter the password or the laptop will delete its data. Your level of victory depends on getting the password and having as few deaths worldwide as possible.

boardgame.name: Schisms & Sacrilege
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Build your own religion! Schisms & Sacrilege is a solitaire role-playing game that breaks down how to make a fictional spiritual movement with basic questions and world building prompts. Create a founder and figurehead, beliefs and prohibitions, symbols and schisms, all with a simple series of questions and prompts.

Take the religion you have made an insert it into your ongoing role-playing game campaign, a story, or any other fictional setting.

boardgame.name: The Bleeding Veil
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The discovery of the thin veil between Amn and the fey domain of Andelein has demonstrated how fragile Amn’s economy and food supply are against the whims of the archfey, Alindaya. Adventurers of your renown must go into the Feywild, figure out what is causing this “thin veil”, and bring stability to the lives of the citizens of Amn. Part two of the Thin Veil Series.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Forbidden Caverns of Ingibjörg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago, when the Kingdom was young, a powerful sorceress known as Ingibjörg was loved by a dwarf named Skelf. Skelf was so devoted to Ingibjörg that he delved a hidden fortress for her deep in the Silverspine mountains. He built a network of caverns that rivalled the great Dwimmervault of the Dwarves. Here the mage could store her treasures and ponder the secrets of the universe . In the end, Ingibjörg’s studies lead her to the dark arts and she spurned the love of Skelf. Cursing her, Skelf collapsed the entrance to his masterpiece trapping Ingibjörg forever. Ages passed, and still the wizard and her fabulous treasures have not been forgotten. They wait in the depths of the mountains, for those brave or foolish enough to find them...

Six One Page Adventures that can be used for any Fantasy Roleplaying Game system. Step into adventure!

boardgame.name: Sewers Great Basins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Love sewers? Of course you do who doesn’t love infrastructure! But maybe you’re tired of those claustrophobic spaces? Try really big sewer spaces on for size! Goes great with other Save Vs. Cave Sewer sets. Or if you need more custom sewer designs, try my sewer builder. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Verdigris Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sure they polished off their opponents, but do they have what it takes to polish the entire dungeon? Goes great with other Save Vs. Cave sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Con-Struction Save
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caves, tunnels, boulders, and more for a higher degree of custom cave building to add to your other Save Vs. Cave Sets.

boardgame.name: Under Sea Cave Construction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Custom Caves beneath the waves? I got your back. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Heavy Metal Scifi Vehicles 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

36 Unique Heavy Metal Science Fiction Vehicles

When your car is half machine and half demon and it breaks down who do you call? A mechanic? A demonologist? A vet? Goes great with my other scifi vehicles. Intended for use with virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Modular Towers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Three base levels, fifteen other levels, three roof selections, and an assortment of turrets and goodies to choose from. Furnished or unfurnished for quick set up and play. Chose the layers you want to make your wizards home, military keep, local despots weekend getaway, ruined watch tower, or whatever else your adventure dictates and arrange them as you see fit. Intended for use on virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Dukes Of Nukes
boardgame.description:
The party card game of nuclear thievery. Someone at the table has the holographic Nuke Codes card. But who? Use cards in your hand to find out who and secretly steal them for yourself. Now that you have the codes you will need to protect them and try to throw people off your scent or everyone will be after you! The codes will switch hands multiple times so can you deduce who has them and be the single player with the codes by the time the game abruptly ends?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Secret Lover
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Secret Lover is a lonely game for a single player about keeping love a secret in which you keep a private journal about a secret lover you're seeing, recording intimate and personal events and thoughts. It requires no materials other than the ability to record your experiences and imagination, but may be emotional or intense at times, so please take care.

boardgame.name: Herewith the Clues
boardgame.description:
Crime Dossier 4 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

The story of the crime is laid out in dossier form, with cablegrams, handwritten documents, photographs, pieces of evidence (including hair), and is presented to enable the reader to take the place of the investigating detective and solve the crime.

boardgame.name: 51st State: Master Set – No Man's Land
boardgame.description:
The expansion No Man’s Land gives 51st State a completely new dimension by introducing an area control mechanism - all players try to gain control over a contested territory.

Players spend their Contact tokens not only to interact with cards from their hand, but also to interact with the No Man's Land board. The board represents regions close to players' factions and is divided into nine areas, with each area providing different bonuses. Players can build their bases and outposts there to get advantage of the region and gain resources and Victory Points.
The never-ending push and pull between players adds a great deal of player interaction and keeps everyone on their toes until the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Vendel to Viking
boardgame.description:
Vendel to Viking is a standalone prequel expansion to Pax Viking, inspired by its mechanics but with some significant differences in the game system. In Vendel to Viking you represent a family in the Nordic culture prior to the Viking era. The game takes place between 550 to 800 CE.

You represent a family in one of the Nordic cultures that evolves into one of the prominent families of the Viking era. Each turn represents a generation and you seek to include the best formidable persons in your family as you evolve from generation to generation. You place family members on the map and use them for accessing effects in various locations, for worker actions or for elevating them into a formidable person. When elevated the family member is linked to a character card taken from a market and moved to an achievement tree. The Character goes to your family board and both the presence in the achievement tree and on the family board affects your family’s opportunities onwards.

The first to hold two Future-level achievements in the achievement tree wins. If no player manages to do so before a set number of turns, the one with the most points wins.

The end state of Vendel to Viking will interface with the starting state of a game of Pax Viking making it possible to play the two games as a campaign.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Everdell: Court of Approval Alternate Art Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promotional Card included in the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter. It's an alternatively named version of the Courthouse from the core game.

Unique Construction (Blue)
Cost: 1 twig, 1 resin, 2 pebbles
Worth: 2 base points

"Gain 1 twig or 1 resin or 1 pebble after you play Construction."

boardgame.name: 51st State: Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
51st State: Ultimate Edition is the all-in-one package for 51st State, including the base game as well as six expansions: New Era, Winter, Scavengers, Allies, Moloch, and No Man's Land.

In 51st State, the world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States has collapsed — and now, thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control of the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new state: the 51st state.

In this card game, players control one of the four powers — mutants, traders, New Yorkers and Appalachians — and try to build their own new country. Players put new locations into the game, hire leaders, and send people to work in buildings to gain resources and new skills.

Every card in 51st State can be put into play three ways: You can invade a location to gain many resources once, or you can sign a contract with this location to gain one resource every turn, or you can attach the location to your state so you can use its skill. One card, three possibilities. Lots of decisions and choices that matter.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: 51st State: Master Set – Engraved wooden components
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: 51st State: Master Set – No Man's Land

boardgame.name: The Necrogenesist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The necrogenesist takes a different approach, compared to most necromancers. While many rely on spells and other magics to animate their creations in a comparatively simple manner, necrogenesists study the state of undeath on a fundamental level, learning to take hold of raw negative energy and build upon it. While they lack the true breadth of capability that most spellcasters have, their creations, by comparison, are forces to be reckoned with.

The Necrogenesist contains:
•A new, experimental “necromancer” class with its own creation system, compatible with the 1st edition of the Pathfinder RPG.
•Dozens of options to customize each character and their creations.
•Favored Class Bonuses for a large number of races.
•New feats for the class and for others that wish to dabble.
•Options for Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might (by Drop Dead Studios).

boardgame.name: Herzblatt: Das Kartenspiel
boardgame.description: In this card game, each player gets 3 cards in hand. The cards show boys or girls with different hair colors. On his turn, the player lays out a card in a grid and tries to make a set with it. Then a card is drawn. Sets consist of 3 girls and a boy or 3 boys and a girl and earn different points depending on whether the set was formed horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The player who has collected the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: A Risky Proposition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a Cepheus Engine Adventure.

The travelers are approached by an unsavory individual with a dangerous proposition that pays well. He is a high ranking member of an organized crime family. He asks that the travelers "extract" an evidence container from a police station on a world in the Sonora sector. This evidence would convict the "boss" and this just won't do.

boardgame.name: Total Party Kill Bestiary Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

What is a dungeon without deadly monsters? As the DM of an awesome 5th Edition game, it’s your job to ensure the players have formidable challenges that test their skill, creativity, and strength. To aid in this difficult task, the Total Party Kill Bestiary makes a triumphant return in its second volume to deliver a hoard of monsters from your players’ darkest nightmares. Hidden within is the greatest collection of high-level threats to appear in any 5th Edition product, guaranteed.

With each nefarious monster comes an arsenal of tools to help you run high-level encounters like a pro. Detailed tactics, colorful ecology, meaningful treasure, and researchable lore for each creature ensure a high-quality experience at the table. Unravel your party’s defenses with the strange magic of the hag giants. Reduce their worlds to ruin with the otherworldly power of the doomstars. Burn to ash all they hold dear with the infernal might of the hellfire lords.

Whatever your nefarious DMing needs, the Total Party Kill Bestiary: Volume 2 provides.

boardgame.name: Were Crabs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Were Crabs is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for three to five characters of 6th level.

Flesh and sinew knit into hardened carapace.
A figure stands atop their tribe, ancient power personified.
Their people weaken long-worn fastenings.
When the bonds break, will you manage to hold back the tide?

Crosshead Studios presents Were Crabs!

In this nautical themed adventure, a group of adventurers embarks on a treasure hunt across the ocean. But not all is as it seems, as other ships are in hot pursuit and strange creatures from beneath the waves are preparing a trap which might change the lives of the adventurers forever... In more ways than one!

Prepare to be boarded! Dive down to sunken ships! Stop an ancient evil from being unleashed! All in a days work.

boardgame.name: The Hermetic Hipster's Guide to: The Traditions
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A guide to The Nine Mystic Traditions
...
He woke up late, groggily groping for his phone on the bedside table, then flinched as the bright screen activated, glaring a time much later than most of his disciplined Order would greet the day. Moaning after seeing the time, as if late for some event, he still began scrolling through various apps and social media updates, letting the last memories of sleep evaporate in the harsh light of a news feed.

boardgame.name: Ultramicrolite 20
Ultramicrolite20
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is Microlite20 boiled down even further. It's suitable for gaming while out walking or when you've forgotten your gamebooks. If you don't have 1d20, use 3d6 to get close enough.

boardgame.name: Nanolite20
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An attempt to reduce Microlite20 even further.

boardgame.name: Donjons Deep and Caverns Old
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:


New classes and ancestries
Animal companions
Magic Items
NPC plugins
And more!

boardgame.name: Microlite2020 Optional Rules
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A variety of optional and variant rules.

boardgame.name: Microlite2020 Simple Mass Combat
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A rule system option that enables mass combat.

boardgame.name: Das Rennen
boardgame.description:
In this car racing game, each player gets their own set of racing cards and a fuel card. The race card to be used for each game round can be chosen by a player from any number of drawn cards in his deck. However, if you draw a lot of cards to choose from, you will also use a lot of gasoline. Once the race card pile is used up, the fuel card is turned over once and the race card pile is refilled. The fuel card can only be reactivated during a pit stop. The selected cards per player are turned face up at the same time, and the race cars are drawn in order of highest card. It is possible to block tracks, slip on oil fields and of course you have to slow down in corners. Special cards allow special moves and can be used once per pit stop. The first to complete four laps wins the race.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Monopoly Junior: Unicorn Edition
boardgame.description: Collect the most cash while taking an imaginary journey through the colorful world of unicorns! Players move their adorable unicorn token around the board buying and selling properties such as sprinkles, glitter, party hats, and other things unicorns love. It's so much fun for kids to place a "sold" sign on their very own property. And if a player owns both properties in the same color, they can charge double the rent! The Monopoly Junior: Unicorn Edition game is a quick-playing board game designed for kids ages 5 and up, as an introduction to classic Monopoly gameplay.

boardgame.name: Gonza Index
boardgame.description:
The Gonza Index is the most valuable stock market in the Solar 175 universe. This vast market trades shares in all the largest space based corporations and is unique in having its home in the most exclusive postal code in Yurushi City. Trillions of credits move through the machinations of this system every second making the gatekeepers of this institution some of the richest and most powerful in human history. The volatility of the Gonza Index is legendary and this flux has led to the fortunes of some and the destitution of many. Which will you be?

Gonza Index is a fast-paced, stand-alone, dice chucking game for 2 to 5 players set in the universe of Solar 175. Players take the role of stock traders in a futuristic dystopia and compete to gain the most credits. Each round you will roll 5 custom dice, take up to 2 re-rolls then the outcome of these dice will determine your actions this turn.

Players can earn credit, purchase stocks, manipulate the market and gain the favour of the powerful broker cards. As you play, unique event cards will be flipped shifting market positions and changing the game. When this event deck is empty the game is over and the player with the most credits is crowned victorious! Push your luck as you invest your valuable credits in this unpredictable financial battle-ground.

boardgame.name: The Arkham Gazette (Issue 4 - Nov 2021) Kingsport Dreams
boardgame.description:
Excerpt from drivethruRPG:

Then beyond the hill’s crest, I saw Kingsport outspread frostily in the gloaming; snowy Kingsport with its ancient vanes and steeples, ridgepoles and chimney-pots, wharves and small bridges, willow-trees and graveyards; endless labyrinths of steep, narrow, crooked streets, and dizzy church-crowned central peak that time durst not touch; ceaseless mazes of colonial houses piled and scattered at all angles and levels like a child’s disordered blocks...

Welcome to Kingsport! Our long-promised fourth full issue, which we have dubbed "Kingsport: Dreams" has arrived at last. Within these pages, we explore some of the mysteries of this fog-draped sleepy village of legend. From the wave-lapped rocks of Pilot Island to the barnacle-crusted pilings of the dockside, through the crooked lanes and alleys, and spiraling up to the summit of Kingsport Head, Kingsport beckons you.

This issue includes the following thirteen articles:

Locations in Greater Kingsport: New places to explore in Kingsport, drawn from earlier scenarios and the minds of our writers.
Hooper's Pond and the Old Brick Powderhouse: Two strange spots west of Kingsport, where odd things have been seen.
The Hall School: Only girls from the finest families in the Miskatonic Valley attend this boarding school, like noted alumna Miss Asenath Waite...
Neil's Curiosity Shop and Other Oddities: The collection (and collector) of Kingsport's strangest tourist attraction is examined.
Kingsport Curios: Seven strange artifacts one might find in Kingsport, from a ship in a bottle to a collection of prosthetic hands.
13 Kingsport Ghosts: An extended prop document, exploring the many ghost stories of Kingsport, with more scenario hooks than you can shake a harpoon at.
Alton Blackington: A historical journalist, photographer, and storyteller, presented as an NPC for your game.
Franklin Waite Price: A fictional folk-artist whose favorite subject is Kingsport's past, described as an NPC.
De Vermiis Mysteris: A deep-dive into Robert Bloch's most famed Cthulhu Mythos creation, the nightmarish tome written by the wizard Ludwig Prinn.
Visions from Yaddith: An unearthly book of poems, as created by Lin Carter, that laments the doom of an alien world.
Dr. Goddard's Rocket Test: Modern science is coming to Kingsport; this scene allows your investigators to play a role in the famed researcher's latest attempts in rocketry.
Bones of Contention: A scenario of secrets long buried, from the mind of the author of Kingsport: the City in the Mists, himself Kevin Ross.
A Kingsport Bibliography: For Keepers who want to explore the stories behind the setting; an annotated list of every Cthulhu Mythos story that includes Kingsport and what details (if any) it provides about the town.

boardgame.name: Waterline
boardgame.description:
In Waterline, you and each other player are trying to build a single pipeline to connect openings in your player grid — but to maximize your score, you want to do more than just make a connection.

On a turn, the active player rolls the two six-sided dice, then each player uses the die results as they wish to draw pipe segments in their grid. You can use the die numbers separately for basic pipe or sum their values to use one of the special connectors. If doubles were rolled, well, too bad; you get a rock and need to place that somewhere in your grid. If a 7 comes up, you can choose any two basic pipe or one special pipe. Some spots on your player sheet are already filled in, so you can incorporate those pieces or avoid them as you wish. Rocks — you just want to avoid those.

After a certain number of dice rolls, the game ends, and if you have not completed your waterline, you score no points and lose. If you have, then you score based on how well you used existing pipes, how many rows and columns you filled with objects (including rocks and unused pipe), how many starred spaces you incorporated into your pipeline, the total number of pipes used, and whether you used more corner pieces than everyone else.

boardgame.name: Peppy's Adventure
boardgame.description:
Peppy’s Adventure is a 1-screen, top-down, action-puzzle game controlled with directional inputs only. You play as Peppy, a bun-shaped bunny, on his journey to rescue the village younglings from the clutches of the Hooded Fox. As you pursue his airship from world to world, you will have to solve your way through short challenging levels as fast as possible facing an army of reckless foxes.

Peppy is controlled in a grid-based pattern where precise inputs and fast thinking are required to progress further. With a fast-paced die-and-retry mechanics, the game incentivizes players to experiment different ways to solve levels by manipulating the foxes and taking risks in order to optimize your records.

Peppy’s Adventure is mixing retro gameplay and 16-bits inspired soundtrack with original sharp sprite-based graphics and a colorful palette. It features simple 2D animated elements and multi-themed tilesets reminiscent of retro console games.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Judges Guild Journal (Installment J - Dec 1976/Jan 1977)
boardgame.description:
From the Cover Page:

Judges Guild Journal
Installment J
December 1976 - January 1977

Thunderhold

boardgame.name: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances Core Set
boardgame.description:
Become the next Master Summoner in the battle arena game Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances, an expandable tabletop game inspired by the popular mobile game Disney Sorcerer's Arena.

Recruit from a battle-ready roster of Disney and Pixar heroes and villains — Sorcerer's Apprentice Mickey, Gaston, Aladdin, Demona, Sulley, Dr. Facilier, Maleficent, and Ariel — then combine the cards for your characters into a single deck. You take turns playing standard actions and cards from your hand to move your characters and attack opponents. If you knock out rival characters or occupy certain spaces near the center of the arena until your next turn, you score points. When a player reaches 20 points or runs out of cards in their deck, the game ends at the conclusion of that round, and whoever has the most points wins.

The rules for Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances Core Set are spread out across four chapters, with each chapter building on what's come before to introduce players to new skills, upgrades, and abilities over multiple games. Multiple expansions will be released for the game line to allow for more team combinations.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Thrills & Chills Expansion
Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Turning the Tide Expansion

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Feuerkrieger
boardgame.description: The Fire Warrior is a new hero for The Legends of Andor. What makes it unique is that it doesn't have a name, color, rank, or special ability—yet! Because you can design this hero according to your wishes.

boardgame.name: Tunnels of the Scarlet Rat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Micklemass, finest city for a hundred miles. But lately the people of the outer city have been facing two rising threats. A crime gang led by someone named the Scarlet Rat has been harassing citizens and exerting control over their lives. Meanwhile, kobolds are increasingly raiding supplies and making nighttime travel dangerous.

The outer city needs help, but the City Guard doesn't have the strength to stop the problems.

Tunnels of the Scarlet Rat is an immersive 5E adventure made to take players from level 1 through to level 3 and includes:

10 new monsters, including 6 new types of kobold
5 new magic items
Over 30 NPC's fleshing out a living city
19 illustrations of monsters, magic items, NPC's, and adventure scenes
DM and player maps for the city and multiple locations


Dig into the clues and discover the secrets of the Tunnels of the Scarlet Rat.

boardgame.name: Primal: A Prehistoric Campaign Primer, for GMs and players alike
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A prehistoric campaign primer, for DMs and players alike.
Primal contains everything you need to introduce prehistoric creatures into your fantasy 5E settings. This 92-page primer introduces a miniature setting with lore to use as is or as inspiration, as well as 50 stat blocks for everything from the most popular dinosaurs to ancient, primal champions. New mechanics for taming, mounting, and riding are also included to give you a new way to interact with these creatures. For players, a new class—The Wrangler—allows you to tame and control them. Also included are 3 new subclasses, for the classes you already love to play.

Features:

A miniature setting with lore
50 prehistoric stat blocks
New mechanics for taming, mounting, and riding creatures
A new class, The Wrangler, complete with 3 subclasses
3 new subclasses for the classes you already love

boardgame.name: Hollow Legions: ASL Module 7a
boardgame.description:
This updated version of HOLLOW LEGIONS includes the complete contents of the original (the entire Italian order of battle and Italian Chapter H—now updated, two desert boards, and eight scenarios), plus all the scenarios, boards, rules, and Desert parts from the now-superseded WEST OF ALAMEIN, plus Soldiers of the Negus, and 29 out-of-print scenarios.

Additionally, HOLLOW LEGIONS now includes the rules and scenarios from Soldiers of the Negus, originally published by our friends at ELR that expands the Italian theater to East Africa and the Second Italo-Ethiopian War of 1935-36. This was Mussolini's war of aggression to conquer Ethiopia (Abyssinia) from Emperor Haile Selassie's largely tribal armies and is widely seen as a precursor to WWII. A full complement of counters for both Ethiopian and Eritrean (allied with Italy) forces is included.

In total, HOLLOW LEGIONS includes a whopping 53 scenarios:

The original 16 scenarios from WEST OF ALAMEIN and the original HOLLOW LEGIONS;
21 scenarios from various out-of-print publications (such as the ASL JOURNAL, ASL ANNUAL, and The GENERAL) that feature either Italians or Desert actions (and sometimes both), including the mini-campaign Line In The Sand;
All eight scenarios from Action Pack 3, which featured the Italians;
Eight scenarios from Soldiers of the Negus.



Components:

one box & lid
ASL Rules Chapter F, revised
Italian Chapter H, revised
Chapter A rules pages (updated for Soldiers of the Negus)
one chapter divider
five countersheets
eight 8" x 22" geomorphic maps (25-31, 25e [formerly overlay E1])
desert overlays (D1-D6; H1-H6; S1-S8; SD1-SD8; W1-W4; X1-X5)



53 ASL scenarios:





Blazin' Chariots
Rachi Ridge
Khamsin
Escape from Derna
Turning the Tables
Fort McGregor
A Bridgehead Too Wet
Point of No Return
The Taking of Takrouna
Too Little, Too Late
A High Price to Pay
Bridge to Nowhere
Retribution
Half A Chance
The Battle for Rome
Ci Arrendiamo
Across the Wire
Showdown at Tug Argan Pass


Camp Nibeiwa
“They’re Here! Reverse!”
Men of the Mountains
Nocturnal Attrition
Cutting Out a Strongpoint
Savoia!
Rommel’s Remedy
Egypt’s Last Hope
A Line in the Sand
The Art of Dying
Twisted Knickers
Castello Fatato
The Valley of Death
Village of the Damned
Winter of Their Discontent
Victory is Life
Red Don
Ghost Riders


Agony at Arnautovo
Tridentina Avanti!
The Last Day of the Cuneense
Gift of Time
Crisis at Kasserine
Recon in Force
Flea Circus
All Roads Lead to Rome
The Hunters Become the Hunted
Our Place in the Sun
Criniti's Escape
The Golden Mountain
The Bitwoded Gamble
Circle the Wagons!
Keber Zabania
The Wells of Borgut
Last Hope at New Flower




(from MMP website)
